data.title: The editor has crashed 1.7.0 fresh install on archlinux

data.title: Failed to move entry EXDEV: cross-device link not permitted
data.body:
win 10 x64
atom v1.6.2

I got an error when I tried to move a directory from my desk to my project in atom tree. I cannot find any help from issues list. I googled it and found it may a npm problem. I am a layman for nodejs. I am not sure if here is a right place I can get help.

data.title: Opening a file from treeview now requires a doubleclick
data.body:
Atom 1.7.0

Allow Pending Pane Items - unchecked

Previous behavior: Clicking a file in the Treeview opened (or previewed it).
New behavior: Clicking a file in the Treeview only selects it. Opening requires a double click

data.title: Command line `atom .` opens wrong directory
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Opening the current directory from the command line using `atom .` instead opens the root directory.  
This happens when using MSysGit or MSys2 but not from the native windows command line. 
I should also note that opening a directory other than `.` does work, for example: `atom $(pwd)` and 
`atom ~` both seem to work as expected.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Use the command line (Bash, Zsh, whatever you like) in either MSysGit (Git for Windows) or MSys2.
2. Go to some directory.
3. Run `atom .` 

**Expected behavior:** Atom will open a new window with the current directory.

**Actual behavior:** Atom opened a new window with `D:\`.
### Versions

Only since 1.7.0 - was working as expected before.

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.body:
### Prerequisites

### Description

When I tried to toggle comment (`cmd+/`) in cucumber gherkin, it doesn't work even I use it from menu bar. I have to put # to each line. I switched to safe mode and it's the same problem.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new file, and set grammar to "Gherkin" 
2. Type in "Scenario: title"
3. Press `cmd+/`

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]
That line should be commented 
**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]
no effect 
### Versions

Atom    : 1.7.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1

You can get this information from executing `atom --version` and `apm --version` at the command line. Also, please include the OS and what version of the OS you're running.

data.title: Windows install/update does not always create/modify bin folder in appdata
data.body:
When the windows installer runs or the auto-updater executes the following files should be created/overwritten in c:\users<username>\appdata\local\atom
- atom
- atom.cmd
- apm
- apm.cmd

Each one acts as a simple shortcut to it's associated script in c:\users<username>\appdata\local\atom\app-1.x.y\resources\cli  (suffixless ones link to the .sh ones)

Various reports of this, using this bug to correlate them into a single issue. Doesn't always happen, need to find out why. Success/fail for these is not part of the squirrel log right now.

data.title: Uncaught exception when adding a specific breakpoint in text-editor.js
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [X] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [X] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [X] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [X] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [X] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [X] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Stumbled upon https://github.com/atom/atom/issues/9929 by accident while stepping through text-editor.js code in the developer tools. Was able to find repro steps that work every time.
Is stepping through random parts of atom source(from app.asar) not supported and will cause random things like this? I have no special tools from atom just the editor.
Was talking with @lee-dohm on the atom slack channel and he recommended I open a new issue for this.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open atom in safe mode.
2. Ensure you have Tab Type set to auto.
3. Open a new tab and type some text.
4. Open a new empty tab.
5. Put a breakpoint in the function `TextEditor.prototype.usesSoftTabs` in text-editor.js. I put it on the first line of the function which is line 2261.
6. Split the empty tab down.
7. Atom is now "soft locked", can't add text to any of the open tabs while other parts of the UI work fine.
8. Switch to tab with text from step 3, tab is empty no text visible.
9. Uncaught exception when clicking in the tab.

What is strange is that execution doesn't stop on the breakpoint when doing split down.
The execution does however stop on the breakpoint on some other actions. For example new tab stops while split tab doesn't stop.
Also just putting a breakpoint on this line and splitting causes problems with syntax coloring being gone and other random things. The exception seems to just be a special case of this.

**Expected behavior:** Atom to not throw an exception and stop working, perhaps to break on the breakpoint I added.

**Actual behavior:**

**Atom Version**: 1.6.2
**System**: Microsoft Windows 7 Professional 
**Thrown From**: Atom Core
### Stack Trace

Uncaught Error: Undefined screen line when clipping screen position

```
At C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\display-buffer.js:886

Error: Undefined screen line when clipping screen position
    at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.clipScreenPosition (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\display-buffer.js:874:15)
    at DisplayBuffer.module.exports.DisplayBuffer.bufferPositionForScreenPosition (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\display-buffer.js:826:20)
    at TextEditorMarker.module.exports.TextEditorMarker.setHeadScreenPosition (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\text-editor-marker.js:185:60)
    at C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\cursor.js:67:31
    at Cursor.module.exports.Cursor.changePosition (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\cursor.js:673:7)
    at Cursor.module.exports.Cursor.setScreenPosition (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\cursor.js:65:19)
    at C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\text-editor.js:1475:23
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.moveCursors (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\text-editor.js:1679:9)
    at TextEditor.module.exports.TextEditor.setCursorScreenPosition (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\text-editor.js:1474:19)
    at TextEditorComponent.module.exports.TextEditorComponent.onMouseDown (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\text-editor-component.js:729:25)
    at HTMLDivElement.<anonymous> (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\text-editor-component.js:3:61)
    at EventEmitter.ipc.sendSync (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\atom.asar\renderer\api\lib\ipc.js:21:31)
    at BrowserWindow.RemoteMemberFunction [as emit] (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\atom.asar\renderer\api\lib\remote.js:143:29)
    at ContextMenuManager.module.exports.ContextMenuManager.showForEvent (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\context-menu-manager.js:172:33)
    at WindowEventHandler.module.exports.WindowEventHandler.handleDocumentContextmenu (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\window-event-handler.js:250:47)
    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (C:\Users\bene\AppData\Local\atom\app-1.6.2\resources\app.asar\src\window-event-handler.js:3:61)
```
### Commands

```
     -0:18.9.0 window:toggle-dev-tools (atom-text-editor.editor.is-focused)
     -0:12 tabs:split-down (div.title)
```
### Config

``` json
{
  "core": {
    "autoHideMenuBar": true,
    "disabledPackages": [
      "linter-pep8",
      "about"
    ],
    "themes": [
      "atom-dark-ui",
      "atom-dark-syntax"
    ]
  },
  "editor": {
    "fontSize": 13,
    "invisibles": {},
    "scrollPastEnd": true,
    "showIndentGuide": true
  }
}
```
### Installed Packages

``` coffee
# User
No installed packages

# Dev
No dev packages
```
### Versions

Reproduced both in Windows 7 and Ubuntu 15.10 VM.

Atom 1.6.2.
Ubuntu 15.10 in Oracle VM Windows 7 host.
apm 1.6.0
npm 2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.5.0

Atom 1.6.2
Windows 7
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.11
git 1.9.5.msysgit.1
visual studio 2012

data.title: Close tab button is too big
data.body:
### Description

It's way too easy to close tabs by mistake. This is especially annoying for the julia console tab, which cannot be reopened in the same place with built-in shortcuts. 
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Open a bunch of tabs
2. Click on a different tab to select it
3. Whoops, closed it by mistake
4. Grit teeth, reopen

**Expected behavior:** [What you expected to happen]

In google chrome, only the currently active tab has a close button. To close a different tab takes two clicks; one to select, one to close.

**Actual behavior:** [What actually happened]

The close button (box? what do you call it?) actually has an even bigger active area than it looks like, so anywhere towards the right side of the text ends up closing the tab. Ideally, you'd reproduce the Chrome-like behavior as above; but even if not, the close button cannot be sensitive to clicks over title text, so make the active area smaller please.
### Versions

I'm on 1.6.2, but probably all versions.

(Note: Atom is awesome in general, but this makes me angry every time.)

data.title: CTRL scrolling the cursor behaviour is faulty in that the cursor does not jump to the start of words when scrolling forwards.
data.body:
Open a text document.
Paste a paragraph of text.
Hold CTRL and scroll backwards and forwards.

When holding the CTRL button and scrolling forward the cursor jumps to the end of each word, i.e to the whitespace preceeding the next word. When CTRL scrolling backward it correctly jumps to the start of each word.

When CTRL scrolling the cursor should jump to the start of each word irrespective of whether you are scrolling forwards or backwards.

Atom 1.6.2
Win7 x64
Base packages only.

P.S on the page which describes how to log an issue, the link "Perform a cursory search" https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-issues is 404.

When theme selection combo box or syntax switching combo is clicked , the select box is out of place.

data.title: [1.7.0] Startup crash on Arch Linux
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Startup crash on Arch Linux.
### Steps to Reproduce
1. Upgrade atom-editor (1.6.2-1 -> 1.7.0-1) thanks to the AUR.
2. `atom --safe --clear-window-state --foreground`. Regular `atom .` from whatever directory also fails.

**Actual behavior:**
![screenshot from 2016-04-13 11-54-36](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5907366/14489674/d12d23a4-016e-11e6-9062-8590a2fe4940.png)

```
[11167:0413/115113:ERROR:browser_main_loop.cc(203)] Running without the SUID sandbox! See https://code.google.com/p/chromium/wiki/LinuxSUIDSandboxDevelopment for more information on developing with the sandbox on.
[11167:0413/115116:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[11167:0413/115116:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[11167:0413/115116:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
[11167:0413/115116:WARNING:accelerator_util.cc(118)] Invalid accelerator token: command
App load time: 1910ms
[11167:0413/115117:INFO:CONSOLE(52)] "Window load time: 1199ms", source: file:///usr/share/atom/resources/app.asar/static/index.js (52)
[11167:0413/115118:INFO:CONSOLE(0)] "/deep/ combinator is deprecated. See https://www.chromestatus.com/features/6750456638341120 for more details.", source:  (0)
Failed to get crash dump id.
Report Id: 
```
### Versions

OS: Arch Linux, with the most recent packages.

```
atom --version
Atom    : 1.7.0
Electron: 0.36.8
Chrome  : 47.0.2526.110
Node    : 5.1.1
```

```
apm --version 
apm  1.9.2
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 3.5.1
git 2.8.0
```

data.title: Menubar items blurry
data.body:
![2016-04-13__10_01_13-about atom](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18436405/14485320/03b34926-015f-11e6-8ae6-13c0af2bbef2.png)
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x ] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [ ] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [ x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

I think it's self-explanatory. Could it be because of the Chromium engine - Visual Studio Code is having the same issue?!
Two disclaimers:
-I don't think this requires safe mode or debugging
-first-time contributor in GitHub(Markdown's still not my strength)
### Steps to Reproduce

**Expected behavior:** The font of the menu should be crisp and clear.

**Actual behavior:** The font of the top menu(the triggering text only) appears blurry. The cascade items that open are OK.
### Versions

Atom is latest 1.6.2, the OS is latest Windows 10 64bit with all the updates.

data.title: Spell Checker
data.body:
Selecting Correct Spellings option for correcting spellings is time-consuming. Two or three corrected spelling suggestions should be available in context menu itself and give the option to see more suggestions if required.

![menu_003](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/18311126/14483443/b7b093ac-0164-11e6-9c7e-9746155c81e3.png)

data.title: Holding down the tab-switching shortcut key should show a list of open tabs
data.body:
If I have many tabs open, often a lot of them will appear to have the same title because the tab size is not large enough to display anything useful. Unless I hover the mouse over a tab title and wait a moment so that the tooltip reveals the path, tab switching becomes a bit of a guessing game.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/14483064/538fc1d2-0186-11e6-8df3-374176fe69ab.png)

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/14483078/81fd647a-0186-11e6-9115-6f295a9ebc14.png)

Other editors show you a proper list of open documents/tabs when holding down the tab switching shortcut (CTRL+TAB for me on Windows). I can then easily cycle through the list directly to the tab I want to focus. The order of the list is usually the same as the current tab cycling order, rather than the ordinal position in the UI. i.e. the current tab is first in the list, the previous tab is next, and so forth.

Another common addition that usually goes along with this is either having a list of the open tabs available from a dropdown button on the tab bar, or in one of the application menus.

Visual Studio provides a good experience for this:
![vs2015-tab-switching](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/14482958/89a2fad8-0185-11e6-8de5-ab850a65f16c.gif)

VSCode is also similarly helpful:
![vscode-tab-switching](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/14483022/f631cd32-0185-11e6-95de-127edec3d3b4.gif)

Sublime Text exposes the tab list as a dropdown, but not when holding down the shortcut. Even so, it's still better than having to cycle through tabs guessing, or having to wait for each tooltip to display:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/298883/14482895/e454cef8-0184-11e6-880d-717a4efc710a.png)

data.title: Don't load packages starting with a dot
data.body: Fixes #9805

data.title: Ignore autorun on our buffered process commands. Fixes #10082
data.body: Fixes the problem of apm and atom shell calls via buffered-process being interrupted/confused by autorun entries in the registry by telling our commands to ignore them.

data.title: Allow A Window's Environment To Reflect The Most Recent atom Invocation
data.body:
This PR splits out portions of #11337, to address:
- Allows multiple invocations of `FOO=blah atom .` and `FOO=bleh atom .` to result in an updated environment for an existing window ("Should `process.env` be updated if atom is invoked from the shell for the same directory multiple times?" from #4126)

/cc @lee-dohm

data.title: Add global configuration for package backend.
Launching atom -d hangs, apm test crashes
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [ ] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?
- [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)?
- [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)?
- [ ] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)?
- [ ] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

If i launch `atom -d` from command-line, Atom gets started (task-bar-item appears, menu changes name and items) but no window is created.

If i try to invoke any `apm test` i get this exception, which hangs at the end, creating full CPU usage:

```

    at Function.Module._load (module.js:286:25)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)

    at Module._compile (module.js:434:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .coffee] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:208:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/florianbreisch/github/atom/src/browser/atom-application.coffee:1:14)
    at Object.<anonymous> (/Users/florianbreisch/github/atom/src/browser/atom-application.coffee:1:1)
    at Module._compile (module.js:434:26)
    at Object.defineProperty.value [as .coffee] (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/compile-cache.js:208:21)
    at Module.load (module.js:355:32)
    at Function.Module._load (module.js:310:12)
    at Module.require (module.js:365:17)
    at require (module.js:384:17)
    at EventEmitter.<anonymous> (/Applications/Atom.app/Contents/Resources/app.asar/src/browser/main.js:54:25)
    at emitOne (events.js:82:20)
    at EventEmitter.emit (events.js:169:7)
```

Launching Atom in normal- or safe-mode works fine - there are no unexpected error messages or warnings.

In order to fix that i unlinked all packages, completely rebuild any caches, deleted and reinstalled dedicated `node_modules/`. The dev-directory (`~/.atom/dev/packages`) is empty, i disabled all packages.
### Steps to Reproduce

I really don't know how this could happen and what i may have done to make this happen. I even don't know how to fix it.
### Versions

```
atom --version
1.6.2

apm --version
apm  1.6.0
npm  2.13.3
node 0.10.40
python 2.7.10
git 2.6.4

ProductName:    Mac OS X
ProductVersion: 10.11.4
BuildVersion:   15E65
```

data.title: Selecting a file when a tab is selected closes the file in that tab!
data.body: In latest version of Atom I have noticed that opening a file when a tab is already selected, replaces the file in that tab with the selected file. I'm not sure if it's a bug or a feature, but I find it very annoying, as I often have a tab selected when browsing through files and when Atom closes my files I have to search for them and open them again. Is there a way to avoid this?

data.title: Fail to build the atom-editor on ArchLinux
data.body:
### Prerequisites
- [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)?
- [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)?

For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide.
### Description

Unable to build the atom-editor since the apm installing error
### Steps to Reproduce

1.Installing the essential packages for building atom-editor, such as npm,nodejs and python3
2. Set python as python 2.7 `export PYTHON=/usr/bin/python2` as have installed python3 in computer already
set npm using python2.7 `npm config set python python2.7`
3. run `script/build`

**Expected behavior:**  build atom-editor completely

**Actual behavior:**  eror for apm installing(it must be something i haven't done)

```

npm: v2.13.3
Installing build modules...
=> Took 4288ms.

Installing apm...

      ^

npm ERR! Linux 4.4.6-1-MANJARO
npm ERR! argv "/usr/bin/node" "/home/spring/download/atom-1.6.2/build/node_modules/.bin/npm" "--userconfig=/home/spring/download/atom-1.6.2/build/.npmrc" "--target=0.10.35" "install" "--loglevel" "error"

npm ERR! Exit status 1
npm ERR! 
npm ERR! Failed at the atom-package-manager@1.6.0 install script 'node ./script/download-node.js'.
npm ERR! This is most likely a problem with the atom-package-manager package,
npm ERR! not with npm itself.
npm ERR! Tell the author that this fails on your system:
npm ERR!     node ./script/download-node.js
npm ERR! You can get their info via:
npm ERR!     npm owner ls atom-package-manager
npm ERR! There is likely additional logging output above.

npm ERR! Please include the following file with any support request:
npm ERR!     /home/spring/download/atom-1.6.2/apm/npm-debug.log
```
### Versions
- `atom --v1.6.2`
- `node -- v5.10.0`
- `npm -- v2.13.3`
- `Os -- Manjaro`

data.title: Tree View makes an unchanged file green as a new file
data.body: ### Prerequisites - [x] Can you reproduce the problem in [safe mode](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#check-if-the-problem-shows-up-in-safe-mode)? - [x] Are you running the [latest version of Atom](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/#update-to-the-latest-version)? - [x] Did you check the [debugging guide](http://flight-manual.atom.io/hacking-atom/sections/debugging/)? - [x] Did you check the [FAQs on Discuss](https://discuss.atom.io/c/faq)? - [x] Are you reporting to the [correct repository](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#atom-and-packages)? - [x] Did you [perform a cursory search](https://github.com/issues?q=is%3Aissue+user%3Aatom+-repo%3Aatom%2Felectron) to see if your bug or enhancement is already reported? For more information on how to write a good [bug report](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-bug-report) or [enhancement request](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#how-do-i-submit-a-good-enhancement-suggestion), see the `CONTRIBUTING` guide. ### Description Tree View makes a file green, but the file is committed and unchanged. The filename includes some non-ascii (Japanese) characters. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. In terminal, execute the following commands: ``` bash $ mkdir ~/atomtest $ cd ~/atomtest $ git init Initialized empty Git repository in /Users/xxx/atomtest/.git/ $ touch Webデザイン.md $ git add . $ git commit -m "test" [master (root-commit) 66a26c0] test 1 file changed, 0 insertions(+), 0 deletions(-) create mode 100644 Webデザイン.md $ git status On branch master nothing to commit, working directory clean $ atom --safe . ``` **Expected behavior:** The committed file is shown as an unchanged file in Tree View. **Actual behavior:** The committed file is shown as a new file in Tree View: ### Versions - ATOM: 1.6.2 - apm: 1.6.0 - npm 2.13.3 - node 0.10.40 - python 2.7.10 - git 2.6.0 - OS: Mac OS X 10.10.5

data.title: Scroll to center is ignored if already visible
data.body:
### Description

When scrolling to a position that is already visible with the `center` option set to `true` (as described [here](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.6.2/TextEditor#instance-scrollToBufferPosition)), no scrolling is performed.
### Steps to Reproduce

``` javascript
editor = atom.workspace.getActiveTextEditor() /* open a file with 100 lines */
editor.scrollToBufferPosition([50, 0]) /* scroll to line 50, line 52 is visible now */
editor.scrollToBufferPosition([52, 0], {center: true})
```

**Expected behavior:** According to the API docs, line 52 should be scrolled to the center of the editor.

**Actual behavior:** Nothing happens.
### Further information

Before e3dabd5200afea5074fb63003951ef677539413e, the behavior was as expected. Maybe the change was intentional, but then I don't understand why.

The problem can be fixed by removing

``` coffeescript
unless @getScrollTop() < desiredScrollCenter < @getScrollBottom()
```

in [text-editor-presenter.coffee](https://github.com/atom/atom/blob/master/src/text-editor-presenter.coffee). I can open a PR with this change if necessary.

data.title: Auto Indent for HTML Puts Extra Indents
data.body:
When there is a new line before a closing `pre` or heading tag and you auto indent the following code, Atom will put an extra indent into the rest of the code. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Newlines before the closing heading and `pre` tags: ``` html

Some Sort of Title That Feels Too Long to Put on One Line

Subtitle

.somecode {
  width: 100%;
}

``` 1. Highlight and auto indent the page: `Edit -> Line -> Auto Indent` **Expected behavior:** ``` html

Some Sort of Title That Feels Too Long to Put on One Line

Subtitle

.somecode {
  width: 100%;
}

``` **Actual behavior:** ``` html

Some Sort of Title That Feels Too Long to Put on One Line

Subtitle

      .somecode {
        width: 100%;
      }

``` ### Versions Atom 1.6.2 apm 1.6.0 OSX 10.10.5
